intro: Leucospermum diffusum, commonly known as the coastal firebush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its bright orange to yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found growing in coastal areas and on sandy soils. It is a member of the Proteaceae family, which includes many plants adapted to nutrient-poor environments. Leucospermum diffusum is typically shrub-like in form, with multiple stems and a compact growth habit.
